title: Pacers pen winning 'script,' return to East finals
content: The Pacers are returning to the Eastern Conference finals after a 114-105 victory over the Cavaliers in Game 5 on Tuesday night.

title: Mitchell can't believe Cavs' exit: 'Let city down'
content: Donovan Mitchell promised that the Cavaliers will return better after saying the team let the city down with a disappointing exit following a magical season.

title: SGA, OKC outduel Denver late in roller-coaster G5
content: Led by Shai Gilgeous-Alexander's 31 points, the Thunder overcame a 44-point, 15-rebound night from Denver's Nikola Jokic to go up 3-2 in their Western Conference semifinal series.

title: Celtics' Tatum has surgery on ruptured Achilles
content: Boston Celtics forward Jayson Tatum underwent surgery on Tuesday to repair a ruptured right Achilles tendon.

title: Granlund nets 3 for Stars, but 'job is not done'
content: Veteran center Mikael Granlund chose the right time for his first career hat trick, recording three goals Tuesday night, as Dallas handled the Winnipeg Jets 3-1 in Game 4 of the Western Conference second round, giving the Stars a 3-1 series advantage.

title: Rose, 'Shoeless' Joe HOF-eligible as MLB lifts ban
content: The all-time hit king and Jackson -- both longtime baseball pariahs stained by gambling, seen by MLB as the game's mortal sin -- are now presumably eligible for election into the Baseball Hall of Fame in Cooperstown.

title: Dodgers' Kershaw set for season debut in Year 18
content: Clayton Kershaw will make his season debut Saturday against the Angels and in the process will tie Zack Wheat and Bill Russell for the most years with the Dodgers franchise.

title: Sun exploring new investment, possible sale, relo
content: Connecticut Sun president Jennifer Rizzotti said Tuesday that the team's ownership group is "exploring all options to strategically invest in the team," including a potential sale.

title: What MLB's decision to lift ban means for Pete Rose, 'Shoeless' Joe and more
content: Here's what a decision to remove deceased players from MLB's ineligible list means for their Hall of Fame eligibility and more.

title: What's next for Jayson Tatum and the Boston Celtics following his Achilles injury?
content: Tatum's Achilles tear and surgery was confirmed on Tuesday. What can the All-Star expect in terms of recovery, and how will the franchise move forward?

title: Rested, recharged, stronger than ever: How Fever's Caitlin Clark used offseason to reset
content: When cameras weren't catching her hanging with Taylor Swift, Caitlin Clark honed her game on the court and in the weight room.

title: Storylines: Scottie vs. Rory, LIV contenders and who could surprise
content: Who can compete with McIlroy and Scheffler? Can an under-the-radar player contend? We look at six storylines to watch this week at the PGA Championship.

title: Tier rankings: From Scottie and Rory to just happy to make the cut
content: Can Rory McIlroy win his second major of the year? Which LIV golfers can contend? We break down the field.

title: Will Marvin Harrison Jr. break out? Can Ladd McConkey be a No. 1? Key questions on 13 second-year NFL WRs
content: We answered big questions about top receivers from the 2024 draft class, including Marvin Harrison Jr., Ladd McConkey and Malik Nabers.

title: 'Ain't nobody like Travis': Why Travis Hunter is ready to be the face of a franchise
content: The Jags plan to play Hunter on both offense and defense, and those who have coached him think he will thrive.

title: Who won the offseason? We look at every Power 4 team
content: Nail the transfer portal? Miss a big recruit? Find a top coordinator job? All are part of a college team's offseason.

title: New NBA mock draft: With Flagg, Harper and Bailey slotted to teams, we project all 59 picks
content: With the Mavericks winning the lottery and the right to draft Cooper Flagg, here's ESPN's updated two-round mock.

title: USWNT celebrates 40 years with beautifully complementary kits
content: To celebrate 40 years of the U.S. women's national team, Nike has unveiled kits defined by stars and stripes.

title: Are Liverpool proof coaches don't matter? Or is Slot just better than Klopp?
content: Liverpool were supposed to struggle once Jurgen Klopp left. Instead, Arne Slot won the Premier League. Do coaches just not matter?

title: Sources: Amorim to pay for staff to attend UEL final
content: Amorim has paid for 30 of his Manchester United backroom staff to take their families to next week's Europa League final in Bilbao, Spain

title: Reports: Forest's Awoniyi placed in induced coma
content: Nottingham Forest striker Taiwo Awoniyi has been placed in an induced coma after undergoing "urgent" surgery on an abdominal injury, according to multiple reports.

title: Last-gasp goal puts Sunderland in promotion final
content: Sunderland will face Sheffield United in the Championship playoff final after Daniel Ballard's header in the final seconds of extra time snatched a 1-1 home draw against Coventry City on Tuesday to secure a 3-2 aggregate victory.

title: Ex-Marshall star helps Sevilla in relegation battle
content: Álvaro García Pascual, who last year was playing college soccer in the United States, gave Sevilla a 1-0 home win over Las Palmas and moved the traditional Spanish club on the verge of escaping relegation in the Spanish league on Tuesday.

title: Ancelotti on Madrid exit, Brazil deal: 'No drama'
content: Carlo Ancelotti said there's "no need for drama" around his departure from Real Madrid, insisting he remains "totally focused" but admitting the team might need "fresh impetus" after confirming that he'll leave to take charge of Brazil.

title: Brazil recalls Marta, 39, despite 2024 retirement
content: Brazil's all-time leading scorer Marta has been recalled to the squad for the first time since last year's Olympic final for a pair of friendlies against Japan, coach Arthur Elias announced on Tuesday when naming the 39-year-old.

title: USMNT to face Korea, Japan in Sept. friendlies
content: The U.S. men's national team will take on South Korea and Japan in a pair of friendlies in September, the U.S. Soccer Federation announced on Tuesday.

title: Cristiano Ronaldo's son makes Portugal U15 debut
content: Cristiano Ronaldo's eldest son, Cristiano Ronaldo Júnior, made his debut for Portugal under-15s on Tuesday in a 4-1 win against Japan.

title: 10 moves that shaped the WNBA offseason -- and what they mean for 2025
content: Seven head coaching changes. Veterans on the move. Teams rebuilding. Here's a rundown of the key developments.

title: Ranking the top 25 WNBA players
content: How do A'ja Wilson, Napheesa Collier, Breanna Stewart and Caitlin Clark stack up in our preseason rankings?

title: No school, no field ... and for some, no home: How the Palisades Dolphins rose from the ashes
content: The California wildfires shook their lives. Now, as a chaotic -- but much-needed -- baseball season concludes, the future of their team is in doubt.

title: Stanley Cup playoff odds: Mikko Rantanen second in Conn Smythe odds
content: Every playoff team's odds to win the 2025 Stanley Cup and favorites for the Conn Smythe Trophy for playoff MVP.

title: Trends and shocking takeaways from the Stanley Cup playoffs' second round
content: As we approach the elimination games in Round 2, here are the major storylines -- and what comes next.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man City eyeing move for Reijnders
content: Manchester City are reportedly keen on a move for AC Milan midfielder Tijjani Reijnders. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Justice BR Gavai takes oath as 52nd Chief Justice of India
content: Justice BR Gavai was sworn in as the 52nd Chief Justice of India, making history as the first Buddhist to hold the position. President Droupadi Murmu administered the oath of office. Justice Gavai succeeds CJI Sanjiv Khanna, who retired on Tuesday after serving since November 11, 2024.

title: 'No DJs, no dancing girls': Gavaskar urges BCCI as IPL resumes May 17
content: Following a week-long suspension due to heightened India-Pakistan tensions, IPL 2025 will resume on May 17 with RCB hosting KKR. Sunil Gavaskar has urged for a respectful atmosphere, suggesting no music or dancing girls to honour grieving families after recent terror attacks. The BCCI has released a revised schedule, with 17 matches culminating in the final on June 3.

title: Microsoft's second biggest layoffs: These are employees to be impacted
content: Microsoft will reduce its workforce by 3%. This affects about 7,000 employees globally. The company aims to streamline operations. Microsoft seeks a flatter structure. It prioritizes engineering talent for AI. New performance management includes a rehire ban. Microsoft follows an industry trend. Other tech firms also focus on efficiency. These changes follow better-than-expected quarterly results.

title: Most overseas players to return for IPL
content: IPL 2025 is set to resume on May 17 after a week-long suspension. Most overseas players are returning, excluding some Australians and Englishmen. Key players like Pat Cummins and Travis Head will participate. Mumbai Indians, Gujarat Titans, and Kolkata Knight Riders will be at full strength. Rajasthan Royals face uncertainty with player availability.

title: ‘Russians join willingly’: Putin mocks Ukraine army recruitment struggles
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin criticized Ukraine’s forced mobilization tactics, claiming people are being “caught like dogs,” while Russia sees voluntary enlistment. Ukraine, facing manpower shortages, lowered its draft age and toughened rules. Viral videos show aggressive conscription methods dubbed "busification." Despite official denials, Ukraine’s military admitted flaws and launched a $24,000 incentive campaign to attract young volunteers.

title: Zerodha cofounder asked an IPS officer: “Do police fine politicians when they break…
content: Zerodha's Nikhil Kamath questioned Bengaluru police officials about VIP traffic exemptions in his podcast. Commissioner Dayananda admitted preferential treatment for high constitutional post holders due to security concerns. Joint Commissioner Anucheth clarified that priority signaling is based on security needs, not widespread privilege. Both commissioners agreed that fewer individuals receiving such treatment would be preferable.

title: Jaishankar's security upgraded with bulletproof vehicle
content: External Affairs Minister Jaishankar, already under 'Z' category CRPF protection, will receive an enhanced security vehicle due to heightened India-Pakistan tensions. This upgrade follows a recent threat assessment and escalating hostilities after India's military response to the Pahalgam terror incident. Operation Sindoor targeted terror infrastructure, leading to retaliation and cross-border shelling before a ceasefire agreement was reached.

title: After India, Pakistan expels Indian official
content: In a tit-for-tat move, Pakistan has declared an Indian High Commission staff member in Islamabad persona non grata, citing activities violating diplomatic norms. This action follows India's expulsion of a Pakistani diplomat from New Delhi on similar espionage allegations.

title: Is Earth in danger? Nasa's alarming discovery of star sparks concerns
content: Astronomers have spotted a supermassive black hole eating a star. This happened far from the center of its galaxy. The event, called AT2024tvd, is 600 million light-years away. It challenges old beliefs about where such events occur. Scientists used telescopes like Hubble to confirm the discovery. This finding helps us locate wandering black holes.

title: US-China trade: Trump says he called Apple CEO after China tariff rollback and...
content: Following a US-China trade agreement where tariffs are suspended for 90 days, President Trump claimed Apple CEO Tim Cook plans to increase US investments, potentially building more plants. This news follows reports of Apple considering iPhone price hikes, possibly linked to tariffs.

title: Taunted as ‘anpadh’, Pune waste pickers clear SSC, rewrite their story
content: Priyanka Kamble and Komal Gaikwad, waste pickers in Pune, triumphed over adversity by passing their SSC exams after facing humiliation for being uneducated. Kamble, a mother who left school in Std III, scored 48% and dreams of becoming an anganwadi worker.

title: Devendra Fadnavis honours Rohit Sharma following Test retirement
content: Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis hosted India cricketer Rohit Sharma at his residence, Varsha, to celebrate the veteran's Test career. The CM conveyed his best wishes to Sharma, who recently retired from Test cricket after playing 67 matches.

title: 'Preposterous attempts': India on China renaming some places in Arunachal Pradesh
content: India has firmly rejected China's claim over Arunachal Pradesh and strongly protested its attempt to rename locations within the state. The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) has asserted that these attempts at 'creative naming' will not change the fact that Arunachal Pradesh is, and will remain, an integral and inalienable part of India.

title: 'Ready to apologise 10 times': BJP minister on remarks against Col Sofiya Qureshi
content: Madhya Pradesh minister Vijay Shah faced severe backlash after a video surfaced showing him making inappropriate remarks about Col Sofiya Quereshi. Opposition leaders, including Mallikarjun Kharge and Jitu Patwari, demanded his removal.

title: Stock market: Nifty50 opens above 24,600; BSE Sensex gains over 350 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Wednesday. While Nifty50 was above 24,600, BSE Sensex crossed 81,300.

title: 'Only a fool would not accept': Trump on accepting $400M gift from Qatar
content: Donald Trump justified accepting a Boeing 747 from Qatar. He said it would serve as a temporary Air Force One. The gift would save taxpayer money. Trump highlighted delays in the delivery of new Boeings. He contrasted the current Air Force One with those of other nations. He saw no reason to refuse a gift benefiting the United States.

title: Coming Soon: Gambhir's Test reboot after Virat-Rohit era ends
content: Gautam Gambhir is now the most influential figure in the Indian cricket setup. With Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's retirements, a new era begins. The focus shifts to nurturing young talent for the Test team. Former selectors emphasise the need to support players like Rishabh Pant. There is also a need to replenish both pace and spin bowling resources.

title: ‘Mere paas bomb hai?’: Passenger arrested at Kolkata airport
content: A 26-year-old passenger from Imphal was arrested at Kolkata airport after uttering the word "bomb" before boarding an IndiGo flight to Mumbai, triggering a security alert and flight delay. Regal Chongtham made the remark sarcastically during security checks, leading to the activation of bomb disposal squads and thorough aircraft inspection.

title: Captain Virat Kohli, the 'Tiger' that burnt bright
content: Virat Kohli, much like Mansur Ali Khan Pataudi, instilled a winning mentality in the Indian Test team. Kohli's emphasis on pace bowling, highlighted by Jasprit Bumrah's emergence, mirrored Pataudi's reliance on spin. Kohli unified the team through fitness and a relentless pursuit of excellence, evident in their historic series wins in Australia.

title: 'Parents killers' Menendez brothers resentenced, eligible for parole after 35 years
content: Lyle and Erik Menendez, convicted in 1996 for the 1989 shotgun murders of their parents, have been resentenced, making them eligible for parole after serving over three decades. A Los Angeles judge reduced their sentence from life without parole to 50 years to life, citing their rehabilitation and new evidence supporting abuse claims.

title: Video: Neil Nitin Mukesh seems angry with Anushka Sen, netizens speculate reason
content: A video capturing a tense exchange between Neil Nitin Mukesh and Anushka Sen at the 'Hai Junoon' musical night has gone viral, sparking speculation among netizens. The clip, shared by Instant Bollywood, shows Neil seemingly speaking harshly to Anushka, leading to comments about potential conflict.

title: Indian trio's exit mirrors great Australia shakeup of 1984
content: Indian cricket faces a transition reminiscent of Australia's mid-1980s rebuild, as Ashwin, Rohit, and Kohli's departures echo the exits of Chappell, Marsh, and Lillee. While these veterans' absence will be felt, India's young talent and confidence, fostered by Kohli and Rohit, offer hope for a less turbulent future compared to Australia's struggles.

title: 'Is this acceptable to PMO?' Cong on Trump 'comparing PM Modi with Sharif'
content: Donald Trump claimed to have brokered a ceasefire between India and Pakistan using trade as leverage, a statement India has refuted. Congress has criticized Prime Minister Modi, questioning the comparison to his Pakistani counterpart. India's Ministry of External Affairs reiterated its stance against third-party mediation on Jammu and Kashmir, emphasizing bilateral resolution and Pakistan's vacation of occupied territory.

title: Trump lifts Syria sanctions, seals massive Saudi investment deals during Gulf visit
content: In a dramatic policy shift, US President Donald Trump announced the lifting of long-standing sanctions on Syria during a visit to Saudi Arabia. This move aims to revitalize Syria's economy and reshape Middle East dynamics, following discussions with Turkish and Saudi leaders.

title: 'Virat Kohli filled the shoes of Sachin Tendulkar and MS Dhoni'
content: Virat Kohli's sudden Test retirement has prompted widespread tributes, recognising his significant impact on Indian cricket. He filled the void left by Sachin Tendulkar as a prolific batter and by MS Dhoni as a transformative captain. Kohli concluded his Test career with 9,230 runs and a record of 40 wins in 68 matches as captain.

title: Former defence secretary Ajay Kumar appointed UPSC chairman
content: Ajay Kumar, a retired IAS officer, has been appointed as the new chairman of the Union Public Service Commission (UPSC). President Droupadi Murmu approved his appointment, filling the vacancy left by Preeti Sudan. Kumar served as India’s defence secretary and will lead the UPSC, responsible for conducting civil services examinations for key services like IAS and IPS.

title: Amitabh Bachchan's granddaughter shares glimpse of life at IIM Ahmedabad
content: Navya Naveli Nanda, granddaughter of Bollywood legend Amitabh Bachchan, is currently soaking in student life at the Indian Institute of Management (IIM), Ahmedabad, where she’s pursuing a Blended Post Graduate Programme. On Tuesday, she gave her Instagram followers a peek into her life on campus, and it's full of learning, laughter, and Maggi.

title: Top stocks to buy: Recommendations for today
content: Stock market recommendations: Anand Rathi Shares and Stock Brokers recommend buying Waaree Energies above ₹2700, targeting ₹3000, Premier Energies near ₹1000, targeting ₹1160, and GMMP Faudler near ₹1070, targeting ₹1230.

title: 'Not pretty': Preity Zinta calls out 'gender bias' after question about Maxwell
content: Preity Zinta, Bollywood actor and Punjab Kings co-owner, addressed a sexist question from a fan on X. The question was regarding Maxwell's performance. Zinta questioned the gender bias in corporate and sports environments. She highlighted the challenges women face in male-dominated fields. Zinta also praised Virat Kohli's contribution to Test cricket after his retirement.

title: Nasa fired employee they once celebrated: Who is she
content: Rose Ferreira's life is an inspiration. She overcame poverty in the Dominican Republic. She battled homelessness in New York. She survived cancer and accidents. Ferreira earned a degree and interned at NASA. She faced setbacks due to shifting priorities. She is now a STEM advocate. Ferreira empowers future scientists. Her story highlights resilience. She promotes diversity in science.

title: Fans launch 'wear whites for Virat Kohli' campaign ahead of RCB match
content: Virat Kohli recently retired from Test cricket. Royal Challengers Bengaluru fans plan a special tribute. Supporters will wear white at the upcoming IPL match against Kolkata Knight Riders. The match is scheduled for May 17, 2025, at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium. Fans aim to celebrate Kohli's Test legacy. A social media campaign encourages participation.

title: Shami slams retirement rumours: 'Kabhi toh accha bol liya kare'
content: Indian pacer Mohammed Shami has vehemently denied reports of his impending Test retirement. Shami lashed out at an online portal for falsely claiming he would follow Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma in stepping away from Test cricket. He affirmed his availability for the upcoming England tour, dismissing the article as the "worst story of the day.

title: Strong 6.1 earthquake strikes off Greek island of Kasos, eastern Mediterranean
content: A significant 6.1 magnitude earthquake struck off the coast of Kasos, Greece, early Wednesday, sending tremors across the eastern Mediterranean. The quake, centered near Kasos and Crete, was felt on several Greek islands, as well as in Israel and Egypt.

title: Vivek Agnihotri calls out hypocrisy over Ranbir & 'Animal': 'Badmouth stars...'
content: Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri didn’t hold back in his verbal assault on Bollywood’s leading producers and directors, accusing them of hypocrisy, cowardice, and creative compromise. In a recent interview with Digital Commentary, the director questioned why the same insiders who privately criticise major stars like Ranbir Kapoor never voice their opinions publicly.

title: Ajay Devgn and Riteish Deshmukh’s ‘Raid 2’ closer to Rs 130 cr
content: Ajay Devgn's 'Raid 2' continues its strong box office performance, nearing Rs. 130 crore in India after a solid second week. The film, starring Devgn as IRS officer Amay Patnaik, maintains a steady grip on audiences, evident from consistent occupancy rates, especially during evening and night shows. The film's performance raises the possibility of reaching the Rs. 150 crore milestone.

title: Salman Khan at Mumbai airport donning a casual look: Pics
content: Salman Khan, recently back in Mumbai after his film 'Sikandar' faced box office challenges, was spotted with heavy security due to ongoing threats. Undeterred, he's gearing up for his next action film with Sanjay Dutt, showcasing his dedication with a gym workout post. He also shared a heartfelt Mother's Day tribute, celebrating his mother and stepmother.

title: China, US Slash Sweeping Tariffs On Each Other, But Is The Trade War Over?
content: After days of high-level negotiations, the trade standoff between the United States and China temporarily paused on Wednesday, with two of the world's largest economies slashing sweeping tariffs on each others' goods for 90 days.

title: S Jaishankar's Security Upgraded With 2 Bulletproof Cars After Review: Report
content: The security cover of External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar has been strengthened with the addition of two bullet-resistant vehicles following a review of his Z category armed central protection recently, official sources said on Wednesday.

title: Pakistani Man's "Don't Act Surprised" Reaction To Operation Sindoor
content: A Pakistani man has come out in support of India's Operation Sindoor. Abhay, a forex trader from Pakistan, defended the Indian army and criticised his own country for "breeding terrorism".

title: Jose Mujica, Once Dubbed World's Poorest President, Dies At 89
content: Uruguay's former president Jose "Pepe" Mujica, a guerrilla fighter and hero of the Latin American left, has died at the age of 89, the government in Montevideo said Tuesday.

title: "Can't Put A Price On Creativity, But Can Tariff It": Robert De Niro Slams Trump
content: Hollywood icon Robert De Niro lambasted "philistine" U.S. President Donald Trump on Tuesday and his proposed film tariff at the Cannes Film Festival's opening ceremony, where he used his lifetime achievement award speech to call for protests.

title: RSS Attack On Colonel Sofiya Qureshi's Home? Karnataka Cops Bust Fake Post
content: In the latest example of cyber attacks aimed at creating trouble in India amid the tensions with Pakistan, a post on X claimed that supporters of Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) vandalised the family home of Colonel Sofiya Qureshi in Karnataka

title: In Trump's World, Aircraft Are Key To Unlocking Political Favours
content: President Donald Trump's long-held fascination with the world of aviation is proving a useful tool for governments and companies seeking to win his favor.

title: India Reminds China Of The "Undeniable Reality" Of Arunachal Pradesh
content: India today once again rebuffed China's "vain and preposterous attempts" to name places in the Indian state of Arunachal Pradesh.

title: Leo XIV's First Instagram Post From Official Pope Account. What He Said
content: Pope Leo XIV borrowed words from his first public address at the Urbi et Orbi after his election on May 8, and wrote: "Peace be with you all!"

title: 9,500 Bunkers In J&K Border Areas, More To Be Built: Chief Secretary
content: Jammu and Kashmir administration is actively assessing the damage and expediting relief efforts in border areas affected by recent shelling from across the Line of Control (Loc), the union territory's Chief Secretary Atal Dulloo said.

title: Indian-Origin College Student Dies In Bahamas Days Before Graduation
content: An Indian-origin college student from the US died in the Bahamas after accidentally falling from a hotel balcony just days before he was set to graduate.

title: Trump Puts Dealmaking Over Rights In Saudi Arabia Policy Speech
content: President Donald Trump sent a message to the world in Saudi Arabia: make business deals and the US won't meddle in your affairs.

title: Trump's Qatar Jet Gift Is The Stuff Of Nightmares In Spyworld: Experts
content: Qatar's offer of a luxury Boeing 747 to President Donald Trump has set off alarm bells within the US intelligence and diplomatic community, where gifts from foreign powers have long been viewed with suspicion.

title: Sean Diddy Combs' Ex-Girlfriend Recounts 'Freak-Offs' and Fear
content: Sean "Diddy" Combs' ex-girlfriend, Cassandra "Cassie" Ventura, told jurors she agreed to days-long drug-fueled sex parties during her decade-long relationship with Combs because she feared his violence, but also because she wanted to make him happy.

title: Trump Asks Saudi Crown Prince, "How Do You Sleep At Night?" His Response
content: US President Donald Trump had an unusual question for Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman as he praised him for making Riyadh a major world business center.

title: PM Modi To Hold High-Level Meet On National Security Today
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will chair a crucial meeting of the Cabinet Committee on Security (CCS) on Wednesday at 11 a.m. in New Delhi, where top-level discussions will focus on national security.

title: Hard Work, Service To Poor Brought Him This Reward: Justice Gavai's Mother
content: Sheer hard work and determination are key to Justice Bhushan Gavai's success and he has earned it by serving the poor and needy, his mother says.

title: 'Humiliated': Diddy's Ex Cassie Gives Searing Testimony Of Abuse
content: Casandra Ventura says she was coerced into sex with male escorts while Sean Combs watched and masturbated.

title: Menendez Brothers, Jailed For Killing Parents, Resentenced
content: Lyle and Erik Menendez, who have spent more than three decades behind bars for the grisly shotgun murders of their parents in the family's luxury Beverly Hills home, could soon walk free after a judge on Tuesday reduced their life sentences.

title: Andrew Painter and other prospects on the rise
content: the Philadelphia Phillies have one of the top pitching rotations in the major leagues . they haven't seen much of painter in actual games . the 22-year-old is a 2021 first-round pick .

title: NBA playoff futures: Thunder move to odds-on championship favorite
content: the Oklahoma City Thunder are the odds-on favorite to win the 2025 NBA Championship . the Thunder moved to -105 win the Finals with the New York Knicks jumping from 18-1 to the second-shortest favorite at +500 .

title: NBA playoff takeaways: Thunder lead series vs. Nuggets
content: no. 4 seed Indiana Pacers beat Cleveland Cavaliers 2-0 in the Eastern and Western Conference semifinals . the no. 3 new york Knicks took control of their series with the No. 2 seed Boston Celtics with a crucial Game 4 win . in the West, the Oklahoma City Thunder took a 3-1 series lead in Game 5 against the Denver Nuggets behind Shai Gilgeous .

title: If Flick can make Barcelona more boring, they'll become unstoppable
content: real madrid beat laliga 3:02 on tuesday night . a total of 25 goals and two trophies were sealed . the UEFA champions league semifinal was a success . it was the final of the laLiga .

title: LSU reigns in latest ranking of recruiting classes
content: Sienna Betts is the younger sister of Lauren Betts . she is the only player in the top 100 who remains undecided . the top 25 women's basketball recruiting classes have at least one tally .

title: Impact freshmen and talented transfers: These teams have the best groups of newcomers
content: the transfer portal has changed how programs build rosters . some schools go all-in every offseason to overhaul their rosters through the portal . others use the portal to add depth to a position or target major transfers who could take a team from great to national champion .

title: Who has the picks, players for a Giannis blockbuster? Tiering every team
content: the 2025 offseason will be known as the summer of Giannis Antetokounmpo . the 30-year-old is under contract for the next three seasons, with 2027-28 as a player option . he will be eligible to sign a four-year, $293.4 million extension .

title: Stop supporting terror or face annihilation: PM to Pakistan
content: IP Singh is Senior Assistant Editor at The Times of India. He covers news in Jalandhar and neighbouring districts, and writes on politics, contemporary trends, Punjabi diaspora and heritage preservation. He specializes in deciphering religio-political peculiarities and complexities of Punjab. His hobbies include reading up on a variety of subjects. title: 🏀 Best of Day 1 at the NBA combine
content: source tells ESPN that the mavericks intend to see through during the draft . there are more than 100 prospects in Chicago this week for the draft combine and agency pro days . players will take part in team interviews, media availability and hit the court for games .

title: MMA divisional rankings: Jack Della Maddalena not alone in making a move in top 10
content: the welterweight champion now owns the no. 1 spot in ESPN's 170-pound rankings . the australian used crisp striking footwork to dethrone Belal Muhammad . Valentina Shevchenko remains at No. 1 despite the loss .

title: Op Sindoor: PM has kept women at centre of India's retaliation against Pakistan

title: India rejects China's 'preposterous' attempts to rename places in Arunachal Pradesh
content: New Delhi's reaction came in response to Beijing announcing Chinese names for some places in Arunachal Pradesh, which the neighbouring country claims as the southern part of Tibet

title: Fake certificate racket busted in Kerala’s Kasaragod, three arrested
content: Racket allegedly helped produce forged university certificates, Aadhaar cards, passports, international driving licences and work experience documents

title: Former Defence Secretary Ajay Kumar appointed UPSC chairman
content: The post of Union Public Service Commission (UPSC) chairman fell vacant after the completion of Preeti Sudan's tenure on April 29

title: Rebate on Layout Regularisation Scheme fee extended up to May 31
content: A total 25.67 lakh applications were received from across the State in response for LRS, when it was first notified in 2020.

title: Injured train passenger’s husband lodges complaint against railway officials
content: The woman passenger suffered a head injury after the middle berth on a train collapsed; Southern Railway investigation on into berth fittings and other lapses

title: Govandi residents up in arms over Deonar waste-to-energy project
content: Residents fear it will emit toxic gases, aggravating respiratory diseases in an already vulnerable population

title: India-Pakistan ceasefire LIVE updates: Pakistan asks Indian diplomat to leave within 24 hours
content: Pakistan has expelled an Indian High Commission staffer in Islamabad; the concerned official has been directed to leave Pakistan within 24 hours

title: Flights connecting 6 airports to resume progressively on May 14: IndiGo
content: Air India will progressively resume flights to the airports that have been reopened, according to a source

title: In a first, Maharashtra approves scientific study on serial killers in State prisons
content: The State government has directed prison officers to coordinate with the team of forensic researchers; the study is said to be based on the FBI’s Elite Serial Crime Unit

title: Operation Sindoor: BJP to organise Tiranga rallies in State
content: A massive rally would be organised in Vijayawada on May 15 followed by rallies in all district headquarters the following day

title: Pollachi sexual assault case: scientific investigation, cyber forensics helped in tracing accused and survivors
content: A team of three forensic experts employed morphological comparisons and other techniques to identify the persons in the videos, says CBI Public Prosecutor V. Surendra Mohan

title: Pollachi sexual assault case: Grit of 19-year-old girl exposed a predatory gang of sexual offenders
content: According to the Central Bureau of Intelligence, the accused followed the modus operandi of sexually assaulting the women and filming the act to blackmail them

title: Rajasthan govt. launches drive to fill 1.88 lakh posts
content: A new global capacity centre policy would be brought in the State to create employment opportunities and increase investments in the service sector, Rajasthan Chief Minister says

title: Pakistan High Commission staffer expelled for espionage, linked to case on leak of Army movements
content: According to the Punjab Police, two people were arrested in Malerkotla for passing on troop movements to a Pakistan-based handler

title: Badlapur assault case: Maharashtra issues guidelines for students’ safety in schools
content: The Bombay High Court had ordered the formation of an expert committee to examine and review the safety protocols for children in schools and other educational institutions

title: Goa stampede: Inquiry committee recommends dissolving the temple management committee
content: The committee’s report stated that the tragedy was entirely preventable, and stemmed from a combination of poor planning, lack of enforcement, ignored directives, and inadequate infrastructure.

title: Push for mega dams at Arunachal Cabinet on China border
content: A joint venture company was approved for five hydropower projects with a combined capacity of 2,626 megawatts

title: Protest outside pizza outlet: Pro-Palestine group vs Hindutva activists in Pune
content: the TOI City Desk is an indefatigable team of journalists dedicated to bringing you the pulse of cities across the nation, all day and all night . our mission is to curate, report, and deliver city news that matters to readers of the Times of India .

title: PM Modi calls for targeted interventions in TB elimination efforts
content: PM Modi stresses need to analyse patient trends by occupation and location; reviews progress under National TB Elimination Programme and urges tech-enabled outreach

title: Namma Metro’s Pink Line deadline pushed to 2026
content: The Pink Line connects Kalena Agrahara on Bannerghatta Road with Nagawara on the Outer Ring Road in the northern part of the city

title: Jute Corporation of India increases MSP to stop distress sales
content: JCI officials said that they are using Indian Space Research Organisation technology to upgrade the workings of the industry

title: Amit Shah reviews implementation of three criminal laws in Puducherry, says FIRs should be registered in Tamil
content: The discussion focused on the progress and status of key provisions concerning police, prisons, courts, prosecution, and forensic services.

title: BJP leader Dilip Ghosh’s stepson found dead in Kolkata
content: The preliminary autopsy report of Srinjoy Dasgupta (27) ruled out any foul play and suggested that the death may have resulted in ‘acute haemorrhagic pancreatitis’

title: Pollachi sexual assault case: How nine men operated a notorious racket in a calm, picturesque Pollachi
content: They approached the survivors, mostly hailing from lower socio-economic backgrounds on various pretexts, including offering them jobs

title: India briefs 70 Foreign Service Attaches on Operation Sindoor; China, Turkiye not invited
content: Pakistan Military announces that 11 personnel were killed and 78 others injured during confrontation with India

title: Bihar introduces French and German language courses in 15 engineering colleges
content: Chief Secretary inaugurates foreign language initiative to boost global competence among technical students; plan to expand to all 38 government engineering colleges

title: Fire engulfs Bevco warehouse in Thiruvalla, liquor worth crores of rupees destroyed
content: Seven fire engines were deployed to the site to control the blaze. Despite relentless efforts for over an hour, the fire could not be brought under control and a large section of the facility was reduced to ashes

title: Southwest monsoon advances to the Andaman Sea
content: The monsoon has reached the region over a week earlier as compared to historical data, the IMD has announced, with the expected onset date over Kerala not yet revealed by the meteorologists.

title: Maharashtra police on alert after anonymous bomb threat email
content: State Disaster Management Control Room receives message warning of possible blast; source under investigation amid heightened India-Pakistan tensions

title: Researchers develop new metal-free organic catalyst which can produce hydrogen fuel by harvesting mechanical energy
content: According to the Department of Science and Technology, in order to reduce global warming and the related impact of fossil fuels, the transition towards sustainable alternatives based on renewable energy becomes increasingly critical

title: Tamil Nadu has given the Armed Forces its all, be it war with China or Pakistan
content: Whenever India is forced into an armed conflict, the State has always stood behind the Centre. Its leaders and people, setting aside their differences, have offered everything, from blood to bullion. Chief Minister M.K. Stalin leading a march last week in solidarity with the Armed Forces, after ‘Operation Sindoor’ was launched, fit in with this tradition

title: SC issues notices to govt. on extended internship, fee charged from medical students who fled war, pandemic
content: ‘The pandemic and/or Russia-Ukraine war had interrupted their education and they have already lost more than one year to complete the course,’ the petition said

title: Stringent law needed to curb menace of wheeling on public roads: Karnataka High Court
content: The court said, “It [wheeling] is a trending menace in the public road which not only endangers the rider and pillion rider of the motorcycle, but also general public at large”.

title:
When Jayalalithaa government wanted 
Poes Garden declared a ‘no flying zone’
content: The government claimed that around 3 a.m. on May 4, the men on sentry duty had sighted a glider-type aircraft, with no lights, making two or three sorties over her ‘Veda Nilayam’ bungalow. The police had earlier been informed of a likely threat to the Chief Minister from the LTTE, which was banned after Rajiv Gandhi was assassinated

title: All 13 accused in Murshidabad father-son murder are locals, some known to the family
content: Father-son duo Harogobind Das and Chandan Das were killed allegedly in communal violence in Murshidabad’s Samserganj police station area on April 12, following protests against the recently passed Waqf (Amendment) Act, 2025

title: Nagpur court extends Kerala journalist’s police custody
content: Custody had been extended for the ‘purpose of interrogation regarding the seized electronic devices, and for proper investigation of the crime,’ the court said

title: Congress seeks Prime Minister’s clarification over U.S. claims of mediation
content: Congress asks if Modi government will conduct a Kargil Review Committee-type exercise to probe the Pahalgam terror attack.

title: Nitish Kumar pays tribute to BSF sub-inspector Mohammad Imtiaz
content: Chief Minister visits Saran district to meet family; ₹50 lakh ex gratia and government job assured; separate tribute for second martyr Rambabu Singh

title: AP will build port-based economy to harness 1,000-km coastline, says Chandrababu Naidu
content: The Chief Minister said that the State will work towards establishing a port or fishing harbour every 50 kilometres to spur economic growth, employment, and infrastructure development

title: Judiciary has to earn public respect, not try to command it: Chief Justice Khanna
content: CJI Khanna showed firm and principled leadership in addressing instances of judicial misconduct, says Justice Gavai

title: Minister Uttam Reddy hits out at Harish Rao, rebuts allegations on paddy procurement
content: Procurement of paddy as on May 12 is 44% higher compared to same day last year; farmers paid ₹6,671 crore out of ₹9,999 crore so far

title: Tripura inducts 332 women constables in major recruitment drive
content: 332 women among 975 constables recruited in State’s largest single induction drive; Chief Minister links initiative to anti-drug campaign

title: 5th president for Munnar panchayat in four years
content: Congress member M. Manimozhi elected president securing 11 votes, against LDF’s Jyothi Satheesh Kumar who got eight votes

title: Kozhikode CBSE schools secure 100% pass in Class X and XII exams
content: A total of 27 schools under the Malabar Sahodaya, two Kendriya Vidyalayas, and Jawahar Navodaya Vidyalaya, Vadakara recorded 100% pass.

title: Temple committee apologises to Muslims hurt by Belthangady MLA Harish Poonja’s inflammatory remarks
content: The MLA reportedly blamed a section of the Muslims for damaging some tubelights put up by the Brahamkalashotsava organising committee, and questioned the invitation extended to Muslims for the event.

title: Norms for reapportionment of teaching staff in State-run schools announced in A.P.
content: The Director of School Education submitted a proposal on conversion and creations of posts, which the government has approved, according to the proposal some School Assistant posts would be converted as Model Primary School Headmasters/School Assistants

title: Shops selling tobacco products in Karnataka require exclusive trade license: Health Dept.
content: District Tobacco Control Cell launched 18-day-long special drive for implementation of COTPA rules in all the 18 police stations of Mysuru city from May 5

title: Fingerlings of yellow catfish released to Chalakudy river
content: The programme, organised by the Centre for Peninsular Aquatic Genetics Resources (PAGR) of the National Bureau of Fish Genetic Resources (NBFGR), took place near Vettilappara

title: CFTRI-Mysuru can emerge as a launchpad for entrepreneurs, says expert
content: The institute in Mysuru can invest in AI capacity-building, collaborating with tech institutions, bringing in data scientists, and building AI-ready labs, suggests TiE Mysuru chapter president

title: Govt. declares human-wildlife conflict State-specific disaster to expedite relief disbursal
content: Government states that the administration will disburse relief to victims  irrespective of whether the encounters occurred inside protected wildlife reserves or outside the perimeter of such sanctuaries

title: BJP holds memorial meet for Sushil Kumar Modi on first death anniversary
content: Senior BJP and NDA leaders recall the late leader’s legacy in governance and party-building; Nitish Kumar unveils memorial park in his honour

title: People’s campaign to develop Chakkaraparambu-Infopark road gathers momentum
content: Thrikkakara MLA demands allocation of funds to realise the long-overdue eastward extension of the M.G. Road–Pullepady–Thammanam–Chakkaraparambu road towards Infopark through Vennala, Palachuvadu, Kalachal, Thuthiyoor, and Seaport–Airport Road

title: Five drinking water plants opened in Udayagiri constituency
content: With this, the number of water plants inaugurated through the VPR Foundation in SPSR Nellore district touches 170

title: Health Minister expresses ire over graft allegations on govt. medical officers, calls for immediate corrective steps
content: A few District Medical and Health Officers and District Health Services Coordinators need to improve their performance, says Satya Kumar Yadav at a review meet

title: Justice BR Gavai Takes Oath As 52nd Chief Justice, Will Have 6-Month Tenure
content: justice BR Gavai succeeds justice Sanjiv Khanna in the country's top judicial post . he will be at the top post for six months before retiring in November . the senior jurist joined the bar in 1985 and practised before the high court .
